Luna 0.0.1
A scripting language for Systems Administrators

Quickstart

Install from source

The Luna interpreter and repl are written in C so you'll need to setup a development environment for C if you don't already have one.

Prerequisites

  • A C99 supported compiler.
  • CMake >= 3.22.1
  • git command line

1. Clone the repository

$ git clone https://github.com/GymateSoftware/Luna
$ cd ./Luna

2. Configure and run CMake

$ mkdir build
$ cd build
$ cmake ..

3. Build

Still in the build folder, run the following:

$ make

Install from releases

You can install the Luna toolchain directly by downloading and executing the following script:

$ wget https://github.com/GymateSoftware/Luna/releases/latest/install.sh | sh install.sh

‍Note: This method is not functional at the moment, please install from source above.

Run the Luna REPL (LunaR)

Run the Luna REPL by executing the lunar command.

$ luna
┏─────────────────────┓
│ ░L░u░n░a░R░ │
│ The Luna Repl │
┗─────────────────────┛
Version : 0.0.1 (dev)
Platform : linux_unknown
[!] Type 'info' for configuration info or 'exit' to quit.
›››

You can also pass a script file to the lunar command to execute that script file.

$ lunar <script>

Next steps

Head on over to Examples to see Luna in action or our Official Documentation to dive deep in inner workings of Luna.
